result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor J. Schreiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall submit to an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than August 5, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor J. Schreiner in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to a preliminary hearing. Court binds defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to Count 1. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarilty and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in counts 2, 3 and 4. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders sentence withheld probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; reimbursementn of drug buy money - $175.00; 45 days county jail with huber and to begin no later than August 5, 2016 at 4:30 may be served in any other county.    - rt
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Taylor J. Schreiner
Current: 2008 Bloedle Ave, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2016)
Prior: 741-1/2 Jackson Street, Wausau, WI 54403
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.   Defendant shall have no contact with A.J.E. - dob:  2-16-1990.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Taylor J. Schreiner in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant of charges and penalties.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders a $5,000.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with A.J.E. - dob:  2-16-90 and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is waiving the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.  - rt
